thread.title: Great Charm and Great Value!
thread.title_full: Great Charm and Great Value! - Review of Hotel Wales, New York City, NY - TripAdvisor

author: Diana G
title: Great Charm and Great Value!
text:
When in New York, I always stay at the Hotel Wales, Madison @ 92nd St, in the Carnegie Hill neighborhood. The hotel, built in 1901, retains all the Edwardian charms of high ceilings, mahogany woodwork, & fireplaces yet offers mod cons like WiFi, bottled water, and comfy beds at excellent value. The area is filled with fragrant flower shops, bewitching brownstone townhouses, and intriguing boutiques. A quick walk takes you to six of New York's finest museums. And if you pre-pay like I do, the discount will cover your meals out. The attentive staff are the finishing touch for why I enjoy and recommend the Hotel Wales.
Room Tip: Rooms overlooking Madison Ave offer light and great people watching! See more room tips
